result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keyuntra Montrell Spears

records.addlTxt: received and filed.

Defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears appeared by video.  Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr appeared by video for Keyuntra Montrell Spears.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for status of counsel hearing in branch 4.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.
CASE TRANSFERRED TO JUDGE HANRAHAN, BRANCH 4.
JUDGE FEISS RECUSED HIMSELF.

Defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears in Court.  Attorney Glenn Oswald Givens Jr appeared by video for Keyuntra Montrell Spears.  Attorney Eric Bashirian on behalf of Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Attorney Glenn Givens was recently appointed by the Public Defender's Office. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material. For reasons stated on the record, Judge Feiss recused himself because of personal and work relationship with one of the witnesses. Per Circuit Court rules, case is reassigned to the Honorable Judge Hanrahan, Branch 4. Additionally, Attorney Givens advised the Court of possible Motion to Withdraw because of potential conflict with one of the witnesses. Judge Feiss contacted the Public Defender's Office. Attorney Givens will remain on the case until the next hearing date. 

Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom video Conference. 
Clerk provided Defendant with Branch 4 Zoom Information.
received and filed.
received and filed.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 12, 2022; received and filed.

Order to Show Cause hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 moved to 02:30 pm.
Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Information provided to ADA Flaherty and PD's Office.
OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT; received and filed.

Order to show Cause hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Information provided to MCSO and PD's Office.

Defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.** 
Case in Court for Status of Counsel hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Public Defender's Office has NOT been able to appoint counsel for Defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Order to Show Cause hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Order to Show Cause hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 8:45 am. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears in court with attorney Eugene James Dietzler.  Defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Final PreTrial. Court reviewed Defense Motion to Withdraw. Discussion placed on the record. Court held colloquy with Defendant. State did not object. Court ordered Attorney Dietzler provide Defendant with Discovery materials. For reasons seated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense's Motion to Withdraw. Clerk provided information to the Public Defender's Office. Court VACATED Speedy Jury Trial date. Court TOLLED TIME LIMITS for the Speedy Trial Demand. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing.  Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 9:45 am. Hearing will be held Via Zoom Video Conference.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:45 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears in Court with Attorney Eugene James Dietzler.  Defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski on behalf of Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Arraignment. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. State filed original Information. Defense received a copy of the Information. Defense waived reading of the Information and entered a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of Defendant. Scheduling Conference proceeded.
State's Witness List; received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine; received and filed.

Defendant entered a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.
EXPIRES September 29, 2022.
Motion filed by defense to dismiss the case based on an untimely preliminary hearing is argued and denied.

Defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears in court with Attorney Eugene James Dietzler.  Defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Wieting. Court took judicial notice of 14CF1794. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Arraignment scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defense Motion to Dismiss - Untimely Preliminary hearing; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears in court with attorney Eugene James Dietzler.  Defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears in custody. Owen M Piotrowski appeared on behalf of Daniel T Flaherty for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for an Order to Show Cause hearing. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Discussion placed on the record. Public Defender's Office has appointed Attorney Eugene J Dietzler. Defense advised the court of Defendant's request for new counsel. Statements by Defendant.
For reasons stated on the record the Court Denies motion to withdraw counsel. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 8:30am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

-received and filed. 
Attorney Eugene Dietzler

-received and filed. 
Attorney Eugene Dietzler

Defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SMB, AKS, KAM.

Defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keyuntra Montrell Spears appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
